name: Department of Defense
description: The Department of Defense is the largest federal agency, responsible for coordinating and supervising all agencies and functions of the government related to national security and the United States Armed Forces.

painPoints.point: IT acquisition delays and legacy system modernization challenges
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - IT Management and Acquisition

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity maturity model certification (CMMC) implementation delays affecting contractor onboarding
Accelerating acquisition timelines to counter emerging threats while maintaining oversight
Supply chain security and resilience gaps in critical defense components

Weapon systems acquisition delays with over half of major defense programs experiencing new delays in 2023, average cycle time extending to nearly 12 years from program start, requiring improved oversight and adoption of iterative design and testing practices
painPoints.source: GAO-25-108528 DoD Weapon Systems Acquisition Assessment 2025 & GAO Testimony

painPoints.point: Specific weapon program delays including Army Improved Turbine Engine Program (21-month delay due to staffing and flight testing issues) and Navy Ship to Shore Connector (15-month delay due to testing problems), highlighting systemic acquisition process challenges
painPoints.source: GAO Testimony 2024 - Weapon Systems Acquisition Delays

painPoints.point: Cloud migration delays and DevSecOps adoption challenges across services
Zero-trust architecture implementation complexity and timeline pressures
AI/ML integration for decision support while ensuring responsible AI governance
painPoints.source: DoD AI Strategy and Ethical AI Framework

painPoints.point: Workforce capacity gaps in cybersecurity and acquisition professionals

strategicPriorities.priority: Joint All-Domain Command and Control (JADC2) implementation
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for operational advantage
Advanced Manufacturing and Supply Chain Resilience

setAsidePreferences.smallBusiness: Strong preference - goal of 23% of prime contracts

insights: DoD has aggressive small business goals and actively seeks diverse suppliers
Cybersecurity and supply chain security are top priorities
Multi-year IDIQ contracts are common for IT and professional services
CMMC (Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification) compliance is becoming mandatory
Strong emphasis on innovation and rapid technology adoption
